basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Harsh Rajgor, a Software Engineer II at Copart with expertise in mobile development across Android and React Native platforms. I graduated with a Master's in Computer Science from The University of Texas at Dallas in 2023, where I specialized in Intelligent Systems. I have a proven track record of delivering impactful solutions, from leading core feature development for Copart's mobile apps to creating innovative solutions like an edge detection algorithm that reduced costs by 85% at Unifynd. I'm particularly passionate about mobile architecture, having worked with modern frameworks and patterns like Jetpack Compose, MVI, and MVVM. When I'm not coding, you can find me playing table tennis, catching up on anime, or unwinding with a good book. I'm always eager to collaborate on interesting projects and explore new technologies - feel free to reach out!

projects.title: React Portfolio
projects.description: Built a personal portfolio in react to better understand the concepts learned during the CS 6314 course at the University of Texas at Dallas. Portfolio includes separate sections for about, education, projects, skills, work experience and publications. It also supports light and dark theme. The project is open sourced on GitHub and is live at h4rz.github.io.

projects.title: Collaborative Filtering on Netflix Dataset
projects.description: The task was to implement memory-based collaborative filtering on the Netflix data. In this approach, we predict the votes of a particular user from the database of user votes from a sample or population of other users.

projects.title: Split Among Friends
projects.description: Split Among Friends is a web application for splitting expenses with your friends. It lets you and your friends add various bills and keep track of who owes who, and then it helps you to settle up with each other.

projects.title: Fashion Brand Logo Recognition
projects.description: The task was to recognize the top 10 brands based on their logo from the live camera feed. My role in this project included collecting data, cleaning the data and training the data on the TensorFlow model maker to generate the model file that was later used in the app.

projects.title: Phoenix Nhance
projects.description: Phoenix Nhance is a loyalty program app that satisfies every customer's shopping needs. With a range of exciting features and benefits, the customers have a safe and seamless shopping experience.

projects.title: Abhigyaan â€“ Refreshable Braille
projects.description: Abhigyaan is a device specially designed for visually impaired people using the braille technology. The user will be able to navigate through millions of pages of information just at one place, they can navigate easily with the buttons provided on the device. Abhigyaan comes with an audio output where the audio clip of text can be heard. Abhigyaan comes with predefined study material which can be accessed anytime. With this device we are trying to bridge the gap between knowledge and visually impaired people.

experience.title: Software Engineer II
experience.description: Led development of core features for React Native apps (Copart â€“ Online Auto Auctions, Copart â€“ Seller Mobile, and Copart GO) supporting Android & iOS, achieving 20% faster performance, 30% fewer crashes, and 15% increase in user satisfaction. Enhanced WebSocket functionality for live auctions and implemented strategic caching solutions across mobile apps, optimizing network resource usage and improving real-time bidding reliability. Spearheaded migration of Android App to meet latest Google API requirements, enhancing functionality, security, and device support while maintaining a low bug-to-feature ratio. Additionally, led and mentored a team of 6 developers across US and India, establishing guidelines for architectural design and code review processes in an Agile environment with bi-weekly sprints. Architected modular SDK using Jetpack Compose and MVI pattern, enabling feature monetization and new revenue streams for the Seller Mobile App.

experience.title: Android Developer
experience.description: Built application for large screen devices such as Kiosk that required working with custom hardware APIs for scanner and printer. Migrated the app in accordance with the latest guidelines provided by Android that resulted in 2x faster developments and a 15% reduction in crashes. Successfully deployed 1 product on the play store that has around 100K+ downloads and 3 service apps to the end-user.

experience.title: Android Developer
experience.description: Reduced the cost to build the Phoenix Nhance app by replacing the paid CamScanner SDK that was used in the app with building an edge detection and image enhancement algorithm with an accuracy of 85%. Handled 2 products simultaneously. Successfully deployed 1 product app (Phoenix Nhance) on the play store that has around 100K+ downloads and 3 service apps required by the product app to the end-user. Developed another product app (Rezy.Tech) and 2 service apps required by the product app.

experience.title: Application Development Associate
experience.description: Analyzed production environment incidents/defects to determine the root cause and providing fixes for the issues. Managed a knowledge exchange database that includes the incidents/defects that have occurred in the production environment for future reference. Automated the manual report generation that includes the summary of defects.

education.school: The University of Texas at Dallas
education.title: Master of Science, Computer Science

education.school: K.J. Somaiya Insitute of Engineering And Information Technology
education.title: Bachelor of Engineering, Computer Engineering

publications.title: Abhigyaan : Source of knowledge for visually impaired using vibrations.
publications.publication: International Conference On Advances in Science & Technology(ICAST), Volume 11, Research India Publications
publications.authors: Harsh Rajgor, Yash Gajara, Nidhi Bhatt
publications.description: Abhigyaan is a device specially designed for visually impaired people using the braille technology. The user will be able to navigate through millions of pages of information just at one place, they can navigate easily with the buttons provided on the device. Abhigyaan comes with an audio output where the audio clip of text can be heard. Abhigyaan comes with predefined study material which can be accessed anytime. With this device we are trying to bridge the gap between knowledge and visually impaired people.
